item.title: [DISTRELEC-6075] OrderCalculationRequest changes required for DE
item.description: Due to change in business requirement, default shipping method for not-logged in b2b , DE web shop customers require Express as default Delivery method. This means we will have to modify the response of OrderCalculation and hence the change are required.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Please see this example request and response xml for b2b not loggedin customer

<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
	<soap:Body>
		<ns2:OrderCalculationRequest xmlns:ns2="http://www.distrelec.com/hybris">
			<salesOrganization>7350</salesOrganization>
			<simulateOrder>true</simulateOrder>
			<orderEntries>
				<materialNumber>18066229</materialNumber>
				<quantity>2</quantity>
				<freeGiftPromotion>false</freeGiftPromotion>
			</orderEntries>
			<freeShippingPromotion>false</freeShippingPromotion>
			<editableByAllContacts>false</editableByAllContacts>
		</ns2:OrderCalculationRequest>
	</soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

Current response xml

<SOAP:Envelope xmlns:SOAP='http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/'>
	<SOAP:Header/>
	<SOAP:Body>
		<ns1:OrderCalculationResponse xmlns:ns1='http://www.distrelec.com/hybris'>
			<orderEntries>
				<materialNumber>18066229</materialNumber>
				<orderQuantity>2</orderQuantity>
				<freeGiftPromotion>false</freeGiftPromotion>
				<listPrice>8.06</listPrice>
				<listPriceTotal>16.12</listPriceTotal>
				<actualPrice>8.06</actualPrice>
				<actualPriceTotal>16.12</actualPriceTotal>
				<availabilityInfo>
					<availableQuantity>0</availableQuantity>
					<estimatedDeliveryDate>20141218</estimatedDeliveryDate>
				</availabilityInfo>
				<availabilityInfo>
					<availableQuantity>2</availableQuantity>
					<estimatedDeliveryDate>20150102</estimatedDeliveryDate>
				</availabilityInfo>
			</orderEntries>
			<paymentMethods>
				<code>WB01</code>
				<price>0.0</price>
				<selected>false</selected>
			</paymentMethods>
			<paymentMethods>
				<code>WB02</code>
				<price>0.0</price>
				<selected>false</selected>
			</paymentMethods>
			<paymentMethods>
				<code>WB03</code>
				<price>0.0</price>
				<selected>true</selected>
			</paymentMethods>
			<shippingMethods>
				<code>E1</code>
				<price>4.95</price>
				<selected>true</selected>
			</shippingMethods>
			<shippingMethods>
				<code>N1</code>
				<price>6.95</price>
				<selected>false</selected>
			</shippingMethods>
			<subtotal1>16.12</subtotal1>
			<subtotal2>16.12</subtotal2>
			<tax>3.06</tax>
			<total>19.18</total>
		</ns1:OrderCalculationResponse>
	</SOAP:Body>
</SOAP:Envelope>

Required response xml after changes from sap :- 

<SOAP:Envelope xmlns:SOAP='http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/'>
	<SOAP:Header/>
	<SOAP:Body>
		<ns1:OrderCalculationResponse xmlns:ns1='http://www.distrelec.com/hybris'>
			<orderEntries>
				<materialNumber>18066229</materialNumber>
				<orderQuantity>2</orderQuantity>
				<freeGiftPromotion>false</freeGiftPromotion>
				<listPrice>8.06</listPrice>
				<listPriceTotal>16.12</listPriceTotal>
				<actualPrice>8.06</actualPrice>
				<actualPriceTotal>16.12</actualPriceTotal>
				<availabilityInfo>
					<availableQuantity>0</availableQuantity>
					<estimatedDeliveryDate>20141218</estimatedDeliveryDate>
				</availabilityInfo>
				<availabilityInfo>
					<availableQuantity>2</availableQuantity>
					<estimatedDeliveryDate>20150102</estimatedDeliveryDate>
				</availabilityInfo>
			</orderEntries>
			<paymentMethods>
				<code>WB01</code>
				<price>0.0</price>
				<selected>false</selected>
			</paymentMethods>
			<paymentMethods>
				<code>WB02</code>
				<price>0.0</price>
				<selected>false</selected>
			</paymentMethods>
			<paymentMethods>
				<code>WB03</code>
				<price>0.0</price>
				<selected>true</selected>
			</paymentMethods>
			<shippingMethods>
				<code>E1</code>
				<price>4.95</price>
				<selected>false</selected>
			</shippingMethods>
			<shippingMethods>
				<code>N1</code>
				<price>6.95</price>
				<selected>true</selected>
			</shippingMethods>
			<subtotal1>16.12</subtotal1>
			<subtotal2>16.12</subtotal2>
			<tax>3.06</tax>
			<total>19.18</total>
		</ns1:OrderCalculationResponse>
	</SOAP:Body>
</SOAP:Envelope>

So that means we need set N1 code as default :- 

                  <shippingMethods>
				<code>N1</code>
				<price>6.95</price>
				<selected>true</selected>
			</shippingMethods>

Hi Evangelos,

is there any update on this ?

Hello Urs,
Could you please update the one time customers as requested in the ticket below with shipping conditions N1?

Regards,
Evangelos
OK. It is changed in Q10 and P10.

Thanks Urs,

We will start testing in Q now.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6064] SEO/SEM/UX - 20% of category pages don't contain the right products
item.description:
Observations :

  • This type of category level http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-15493 say the lower category "Lithium Button Cells" contain "72" products :
  • The link send the user to http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-15695, it contain 13 products :
  • Those url about "Lithium Button Cells" are accessible on every hybris websites and are provided over Google Sitemaps & SEM :
    http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-15697 (6 produtcs)
    http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-15695 (13 produtcs)
    http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-196003 (13 produtcs)
    http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-15705 (17 produtcs)
    http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-15710 (11 produtcs)
    ...
    Which all together contain 72 products !
  • This issue happen in 20% of the categories of every hybris websites (data verified by a crawl of the entire distrelec.ch website).
    (sample : http://jira.distrelec.com/secure/attachment/16037/sample.txt)

Impacts :

  • UX : Generate deceptive empty landing page for 20% of the categories and lead to an high bounce rate on high quality traffic.
  • SEO : Create DUST (duplicate url, similar text) and low quality content on 20% of our categories, which make impossible to rank and bring traffic on any of this pages.
  • SEM : Generate deceptive empty landing pages for 20% of the online campaign and lead to an high bounce exit rate on high quality traffic and a waste of advertisement budget.
  • EMAIL : Generate deceptive empty landing pages for 20% of the online campaign on category pages and lead to an high bounce exit rate on high quality traffic.

Demands :

  • Global - Generate a unique category page containing all products for those amputated categories ASAP (IT + PIM).
  • SEO/SEM - Redirect all "amputated category pages" to the main category page containing all the products (Pierre + PIM + Francesco)

Checking process :

  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO/SEM/UX - 20% of category pages don't contain the right products

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I just give it as input: What's the exact reason why we don't fix this from PIM side?
Because it would mean refactoring the entire PIM.
I'm checking a solution to add numbers for a working differentiation from DQ side.

Omikron has been asked to analyse the query (URL) sent to Fact Finder.

It appears that the shop sends a substringFilterproductFamilyCode criteria that causes the bug.

From : http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Netzteile-%26-Licht/Batterien-Ladeger%C3%A4te-Regenerativ/Ger%C3%A4tebatterien/Knopfzellen-Batterien/c/cat-15493

If you click on the category Name Lithium-Knopfzellen (category 5), the following query is sent to FF :

http://10.191.20.145:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/AdminMode.ff?query=*&filterCategory3=&useCampaign=false&filterCategory5=Lithium-Knopfzellen&filterCategory4=Knopfzellen-Batterien&channel=distrelec_P_7310_ch_de&substringFilterproductFamilyCode=15695

This is the issue. Remove this criteria "substringFilterproductFamilyCode" and it will work.

I hope it helps
J-W

The correct link for Pierre's example would look like this:

http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Batteries-Chargers-Renewable/Primary-Batteries/Button-cell-batteries/c/cat-15493?q=*&filter_Category4=Button+cell+batteries&filter_Category3=Primary+Batteries&filter_Category5=Lithium+Button+Cells (PL cat-ID instead of FamilyCode)
@Florian : When is it planned to fixed this issue ?

Hi Pierre
It's planned in the current sprint. It will end in W07.
I'll take a look in it together with the developer tomorrow.

Hi Florian,
Great news, thank you

I removed the productFamilyCode parameter. I tested it in my local environment and it works fine. Committed in v3.2. Ready for test deployment. I also attached a screenshot of the new ff query result.
Thank you Will !
You are welcome
When will it be deployed on Q ?

CODE FREEZE FOR TRUNK
Date: Today ( 03.02.2015 )
Time: 15:00 PM
Release: v3.2.m0
Reason: Deployment to HP-Q of new 3.2 release

The deployment will start today (03.02.2015) at around 15:15 PM

Q deployment is today. You can test tomorrow.

I just tried it on Q, it's perfect !
It's ready for P
Thank you very much Will !!!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5989] EE - MwSt should not be calculated for B2B
item.description:
MOVEX SHOPS CZ/HU/SK/RO Issue
Business-customers get charged with MwSt. this is not correct.

Requirement (by Peter Szuchomelli) Verified:

  1. If the customer is a business-customer then tax should NOT be charged & shown.
  2. If the customer is a private-customer then tax should be charged & shown.

Note: This is NOT valid for AT.
item.summary: EE - MwSt should not be calculated for B2B

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Is the pricing not done by SAP?
Please check everything related to the Movex (without taxes etc.)

Adjusted specification.
@Will: These are Movex-Based countries therefore no SAP connection yet.
@Flo: Robert Spittaler said they don't have to change anything in Movex as they already don't charge mwst for b2b-customers in those countries.
Ok. I check the movex case.
Implemented new flag on website to turn on/off tax calculation for B2B checkout in each country.

commited in v3.1. ready for test deployment. what needs to be tested:

  • b2c checkout process
  • b2b checkout process -> turn on/off tax calculation flag in hmc on website
  • movex order export job
Mwst is shown as 0.- but it gets calculated. See screenshot - Please check.

Hi Rafi,
The taxes are calculated correctly when the customer is buying.
Only the b2b or b2c channels, if the customer is logged out, are showing the taxes.
I will activated it again and we have to clarify with the business if we have to change the complete display of the taxes.

I have asked the business.
I will close this ticket.
The MwSt is still calculated for the shipping-costs. Please check as well the creditcard-fees when fixing, thx
Mwst is also still calculated for payment-costs. I will fix this as well.

Hi Rafael

I fixed the issue in v3.2. Now we use the net delivery & net payment costs. I also attached you a screenshot with a summary of the checkout values. Ready for test deployment.

Should I fix this issue in another version? Or is it enough in v3.2?

Cheers
Will
fixed in v3.1.15. ready for test deployment.

So far however this ticket has still had an Approved-status. Have you already done some further implementations? - FYI: According to a short cross-check many implementations require refactoring. Thx Mark

I along with ruben figured out some big problem with current implementation of webtrekk. And we are sure that was the reason why tracking information were wrong.
However to correct them all needs a lot of re-factoring specially on front end side, we are on that phase right now and soon we will start testing.
Sorry for inconveniences caused by the issue. We will update you as soon as we are ready for testing.

Thanks

Neeraj Shandilya | Distrelec Could you please have a look?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6237] Cart gets deleted overnight
item.description:
A customer complained that the cart get's deleted overnight. I made a test and found this to be true. I put yesterday late afternoon some products into the cart (logged in). This morning they were gone. A check in HMC revealed the actual cart was modified upon login (See screenshot). Please investigate and fix.

Requirement: The cart needs to be persistent for logged-in customers.

user: distrelec.testing+ch.b2b.2309@gmail.com
pw: distrelec

Needs to be checked in Fixversion: 3.2

Reporter: urs.steiner@num.com

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi,

After some investigations, we found out the root cause of cart deletion. The invalidation of the Hybris JaloSession is the responsible of the cart removal. To resolve this issue, we need to override the standard hybris JaloSession to prevent the cart removal.

https://wiki.hybris.com/display/forum/Working+with+multiple+carts?focusedCommentId=137201342

/Nabil.
As discussed - please review with Rene Hämmerli from Namics first.

Hi,

I implemented the new logic of the JaloSession. At session invalidation, we have the following cases:

  • If the user is null or anonymous, then the cart is removed from the session and from the database ( not persisted)
  • Otherwise, the cart is removed only from the session but still persisted

Hi Rafi,
please test on Q.

comments.comment:
Hello Florian,
As we discussed yesterday we had done an update in the interface in order to be able to deactivate contact persons over the Webshop. This was implemented by setting department code 9999 (inactive). It seems that the error you get is because something has not been properly updated in the read method from your side. The CP 9999 was not communicated to the business and currently this is only setup through the Webshop. As an example contact person 0000184993 of the attached customer.

Hi Nabil,
Could you please implement a specific error message?
If we get back this error "9999 is not a valid department code" we should show the weeor message "We cannot activate your account. Please contact our customer service".

Hi Nabil,
The issue seems to come from the web shop side.
If one contact has defined the department 9999 we are using this for all contacts of the company.
This should be only related to this specific contact.
As discussed with Florian Bühler | Distrelec, we just ignore the department code 9999.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6091] Some PIM attributes hold non-localized values. Store them as non-localized values in hybris.
item.description:
Currently we store each PIM attribute language specific in the hybris database - even if the values for all languages are the same. Eg the eClass numbers or UNSPSC numbers are stored for each language although the numbers are the same for each language.

Meanwhile there are about 90 Mio attribute values (ProductFeatures) in the hybris database. This is too much to keep the index in Oracle's memory. As a result, access is much slower due to the required disk access. Improvement is possible by reducing the number of records.

Question:
Can we find out, which attributes are really language dependent? All other attributes should only be stored ONCE in hybris and being used for ALL languages.

See also main ticket DISTRELEC-5581.
item.summary: Some PIM attributes hold non-localized values. Store them as non-localized values in hybris.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
@Önder: As we agreed yesterday we are defining the list of attributes that do NEVER contain language dependant data in hybris. We want to start with the most often used attributes (root attributes) that will have the biggest impact.

Can you please confirm, that the following attributes are numbers that are the same for ALL languages:

  • ERP_EANCode
  • eclass40
  • eclass41
  • eclass50
  • eclass51
  • eclass60
  • eclass62
  • eclass70
  • eclass71
  • eclass80
  • esn
  • jAndj
  • unspsc11
  • unspsc13
  • unspsc13_1
  • unspsc15
  • unspsc3
  • unspsc5
  • unspsc70901
  • unspsc8
  • unspsc_Unilever
I confirm. Go ahead...

See attached screenshot

Specification

  • BE: The default shipping method should be Express for germany(B2B).
  • FE: Remove the outter brackets, it should look like this: "Economy (Lieferung in 3-5 Tagen)"

But there is no as such Express shipping method, please refer the attached screenshot and confirm that you want to if you mean to change it to Standard or Express is altogether another new shipping method ?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5920] Registration - VAT Review
item.description:
In this ticket the different VAT-Formats will be reviewed per country and according validations & descriptions will be specified below.
Knowledge-base: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VAT_identification_number

Specification

  1. The VAT-ID Form-field(Screenshot point 1) should be pre-filled with the values from(Form-field) from the list below. The filled text should be greyed out and dissapear as soon as the form-field is clicked.
  2. The text in the Info-Box(Screenshot point 2) should be replaced with the relating values(Hint) from the list below.

NOTE: Only fill values from below which are marked bold.

Countries

  • CH(en):
    • Description: VAT number
    • Abbrevation: VAT
    • Format: CHE 9 + numeric digits e.g. CHE-123.456.789
    • Form-field: CHE-123456789
    • Hint: 'CHE-' followed by 9 numeric digits, e.g. CHE-123456789
  • CH(de):
    • Description: Mehrwertsteuernummer
    • Abbrevation: MWST
    • Format: CHE 9-stellig z.B. CHE-123.456.789
    • Form-field: CHE-123456789
    • Hint: 'CHE-' gefolgt von 9 Ziffern, z.B. CHE-123456789
  • CH(fr):
    • Description: Taxe sur la Valeur Ajoutée
    • Abbrevation: TVA
    • Format: CHE suivi de 9 chiffres Exemple CHE-123.456.789
    • Form-field: CHE-123456789
    • Hint: CHE suivi de 9 chiffres Exemple CHE-123.456.789
  • DE(de):
    • Description: Umsatzsteuer-Identifikationsnummer
    • Abbrevation: USt-IdNr.
    • Format: DE gefolgt von 9-stelliger Zahl z.B. DE123456789
    • Form-field: DE123456789
    • Hint: 'DE' gefolgt von 9 Ziffern, z.B. DE123456789
  • DE(en):
    • Description: Umsatzsteuer-Identifikationsnummer
    • Abbrevation: USt-IdNr.
    • Format: DE followed by 9 digits, e.g. DE123456789
    • Form-field: DE123456789
    • Hint: 'DE' followed by 9 digits, e.g. DE123456789
  • AT:
    • Description: Umsatzsteuer-Identifikationsnummer
    • Abbrecation: UID
    • Format: 'ATU'+8 Zahlen, – z.B. ATU12345678
    • Form-field: ATU12345678
    • Hint: 'ATU' gefolgt von 8 Ziffern, z.B. ATU12345678
  • IT:
    • Description: Partita IVA
    • Abbrevation: P.IVA
    • Format: 11 digits
    • Form-field: 12345678901
    • Hint: Stays as it actually is.
  • LT:
    • Description: PVM mokėtojo kodas
    • Abbrevation: PVM kodas
    • Format: 9 arba 12 skaitmenų
    • Form-field: 123456789012
    • Hint: 9 arba 12 skaitmenų
  • HU:
    • Description: Közösségi adószám
    • Abbrevation: ANUM
    • Format: 8 számjegy (a magyar adószám első 8 száma), pl. HU12345678
    • Form-field: HU12345678
    • Hint: 'HU' + 8 számjegy (a magyar adószám első 8 száma), pl. HU12345678
  • RO:
    • Description: Codul de identificare fiscală
    • Abbrevation: CIF
    • Format: Consista din 2 pana la 10 cifre
    • Form-field: 1234567890
    • Hint: Consista din 2 pana la 10 cifre
  • CZ:
    • Description: Daňové identifikační číslo
    • Abbrevation: DIČ
    • Format: 'CZ', následuje 8-10 číslic, například CZ1234567890
    • Form-field: CZ1234567890
    • Hint: 'CZ', následuje 8-10 číslic, například CZ1234567890
  • SK:
    • Description: Identifikačné číslo pre daň z pridanej hodnoty
    • Abbrevation: IČ DPH
    • Format: 'SK', nasleduje 10 číslic, napríklad SK1234567890
    • Form-field: SK1234567890
    • Hint: 'SK', nasleduje 10 číslic, napríklad SK1234567890

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5861] Redesign Header: Suggest Layer
item.description:
Redesign search suggest layer as per
https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/911-4a+Search

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
There is new a «search term suggestion» on top of the first column in redesigned SuggestLayer (see attached distrelec_redesign-suggest-layer.png).

At the moment there are no suggested terms delivered, if I do an ajax call to /search/autocomplete or /search/autocompleteSecure. As example, please see attached screenshot (result_suggested-searchTerms.png) or this url https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/search/autocompleteSecure?term=usb.

Could you check this issue, please?

Thank you & BR
Petra

Hi Florian
Could you assign this issue to a BE-Engineer?
Thank you & kind regards
Petra
need some clarification

Hi Surendra
What do you need to clarify?
Let me know, if I can help you – BR
Petra

Hi Petra,

I need clarification from one of my developer.

Surendra

Hi Petra,

Could you please configure your Factfinder server(i.e Q System) according to the attachement(FactFinder-settings.docx) in your development environment.

As I have tested, I could see the result as show in the screenshot(search_autocompleteSecure_term=usb.png).

Hi Surendra

Thank you. Now I get the same result as you.

But I'm wondering why there always is just one result at «terms», instead of max. 5? For example, try ..
https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/search/autocompleteSecure?term=diode
https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/search/autocompleteSecure?term=led

Or there often is no result at «terms», for example try ..
https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/search/autocompleteSecure?term=relais

Do you know why that's the case?

BR
Petra

... and if I understand it correctly, attribute «url» of «suggested terms» shouldn't be null.
There should be the search query for this term delivered (for example name: "usb", url: "/search?q=usb")

Could you check it, please?
Merci & BR
Petra

Hi Petra

There is no url attribute in soap response. Please have look at the attachement(soap_reponse.xml) at the line between number 937- 960.

<type xmlns="http://suggest.ws69.webservice.factfinder.de">searchTerm</type> at line 960.

It is for a search https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/search/autocompleteSecure?term=relais

Hi Surendra

Thank you for the attachement. Could you add the attribute «query» (line number 953 in the xml) also to the json response?

There should be more than 1 result (max. 5) for ResultSuggestion with type searchTerm .. is this maybe a FF configuration issue, to deliver the correct number of results?

Thank you & cheers
Petra
Hi Petra, Please look at the recent attachment.

Hi Surendra, what exactly would you say with this screenshot? In line 952 of the XML you can see attribute «query», but this isn't available in json ...

Cheers
Petra
HI, I will assign this ticket to Nabil. I think he could help you out with that.

Hi,

I think this also require an activation in Fact-Finder itself.

Daniela Truttmann | Distrelec could you please activate it or show us how to do ? thx

BR, Nabil.

Hi Daniela,

Please check the FF configuration. Thx.

Hi Nabil

It works in CH-DE and CH-EN. I will test the behaviour.
I assume though, that the real impact of this feature is only visible on P, where we really have traffic and searches.

/Daniela

Hi Daniela,

I tried it on both channels CH-DE and CH-EN but I get always one term suggestion (which is the query itself)

http://10.191.21.143:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/Suggest.ff?channel=distrelec_Q_7310_ch_de&query=led&format=xml
http://10.191.21.143:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/Suggest.ff?channel=distrelec_Q_7310_ch_en&query=led&format=xml

Hi Nabil

It's a different story on P (CH-DE is set up accordingly). There you get a varied list (see attached screenshot).

/Daniela

Hi Daniela,

I tried it on P but we need it on Q system as well for testing. Thx

Hi Nabil

It is up and running in Q, but due to the volume I assume it only brings the suggesions it does. I have asked the consultant to send us more information if possible so that I can look into this. However, I think it's working fine, it's just because we don't have any traffic and maybe also some different data resources (the suggest is based on different sources and what happens in the background to build the effective suggestions I do not know) that we get these "weird" results.

/Daniela

Hi Petra,

the BE implementation is working fine.However, the FF Q is returning always only one suggestion term unlike FF P.

/Nabil.

Hi Nabil

I got some more information about the suggest functionality. The suggestions are composed of both the search term but also the clicks generated with a term. Furthermore, it takes into account ranking rules - which are different from P to Q.

All these things together explain why we have such a striking difference between P and Q.

/Daniela

Hi Nabil

Although there is just one result returned by FF on Q, I need still the URL to which I can link to.

URL of searchTerm is still null, you can see it here: https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/search/autocompleteSecure?term=led&categoryRestrictions=.

Please also have a look at Redesign_header (1).png: I guess the URL-value should be the value from attribute «query» on line 952 of the XML ...

Thx for checking it & cheers
Petra

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5860] Redesign Header: Basics (category dropdown, new my account menu with flyout)
item.description:
Redesign of

  • Search bar with new category drodpwon as per https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/911-4a+Search
  • My account menu as per https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/911-4b+My+Account+Menu
item.summary: Redesign Header: Basics (category dropdown, new my account menu with flyout)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Florian

In the redesigned search bar (https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/911-4a+Search) it's possible to select one or more 1st-level categories in which the search should be executed.
Therefor I need following from BE:

– The name of each 1st level category as string (to show them all in the dropdown)

– The filterstring of each 1st level category (for example: filter_Category1=Automation), which I can add to the query string, to execute the search correctly.

Could you assign this to one of your BE-Engineers?

Thank you & BR,
Petra
Committed in v3.2 (trunk). Modified metahd-item-categories.jsp accordingly. Added all level one category information.

Hi Will

After updating svn on trunk and a build, there are no $

{levelOneCategories}

delivered.

As I can see in metahd-item-categories.jsp, I guess the attribute «name» contains the category name. Which attribute contains its filterstring (for example: filter_Category1=Automation)?

Could you check it, please?

Thank you, BR
Petra

Hi Petra

Which attribute from the category do you need for the filter_Category1 parameter? Dont you use the name for this parameter?

I attached you a screenshot, let me know which attribute you need for the parameter.

Thanks
Will

Hi Will

Finally I will generate search strings like following to execute the search:
1) /search?q=usb&filter_Category1=Components&filter_Category1=… (one or more categories selected)
2) /search?q=usb (no specific category selected, search over all categories)

I'm not sure .. Will it work, if I generate the category filterstring only with the base string «filter_Category1=» and the name attribute? Isn't therefor a filterstring generated from FF required?

BR & Thanks
Petra

Hi Petra

Yes we can simply use the name of the category.

Cheers
Will

Thank you.

The other issue unfortunately still exists: There are no $

{levelOneCategories}

delivered to FE (but there should be 5 1st level categories).

Could you check it, please?
BR
Petra

Hi Petra

The level one categories are coming from the main nav node.I think you just need to create the CMSNavigationEntry for each child of the main nav node. I attached you some screenshots. You can have a look at hmc Q http://10.191.21.140:9001/hmc/hybris how the linking is done. My screenshots should help you to find out where you have to check the linking.

If you still have any questions, just give me feedback.

Cheers
Will

Hey Will

Thank you.
It looks like this was part of the problem. I just added the CMSNavigationEntry for first child of MainNav for testing.
Now, $

{levelOneCategories}

is not empty anymore. But I don't get a name displayed (I'm on distrelec-ch.local with selected language "DE"). I should get the name of main nav node, right? In main nav node the DE-value for title is correctly filled in.

Could you check it please?
Thx & BR
Petra

Hi Petra

You should get the name of the linked category. Pls check the category name linked in CMSNavigationEntry.

Cheers
Will

Hi Will

I checked the names (please see attached screenshot hmc_navnode-components.png) and with ...

<c:if test="$

{not empty levelOneCategories}

">
<c:forEach items="$

{levelOneCategories}

" var="level1category">
<c:set var="categoryName" value="$

{level1category.name}

" />
<input id="all" name="TODO: Auto apply filter" class="checkbox" type="checkbox" value="true">
<label for="all">$

{categoryName}</label>
</c:forEach>
</c:if>

... I get just the checkbox as output in FE, but no name (${categoryName}

).

Thx & BR
Petra

Maybe not a problem at all, if so please disregard my comment, but is the selected approach of fetching the 1st level categories also appropriate if for a given user one or many of the 1st level categories are hidden from the main nav? They should then also be hidden in the dropdown.
Lets have a look at this tomorrow. When would you have time? I will prepare my environment accordingly tonight.

Hallo Will

For executing search, I now have to send the selected categories to BE.
There are two cases:

1) via Ajax (/search/autocompleteSecure)
here it would be nice, if I could send you a list with all categories which are selected. Could you add a property (name, for example: categoryRestrictions) for this case?

2) on form submit (/search)
here I could send you the selected category names via hidden input field. I could send them for example semicolon-separated in one field, or send a field per category.. what would you prefer? Therefor I would also need a property from BE ...

Just let me know, if there are some questions.
Thx & cheers
Petra

Hi Petra

Is there any other place where we already implemented such a property? I could use this for me as an example. That I know exactly what I've to do.

Cheers
Will

As example you can look at module checkout-btn-continue.jsp, where we submit some checkout details via hidden-fields to /checkout/address/continueCheckout.

Cheers
Petra

Hi Petra

I have another question. Are you submitting this information to /search ?

Thx
Will

Hi Will

Not yet, but I have to. It's case 2, I could submit the names of selected categories via hidden-fields to /search to BE (same way as it's done in checkout-btn-continue.jsp).

BR
Petra

Hi Petra

I implemented a new parameter called "categoryRestrictions" in the SearchPageController. It is a list of strings. You can simply submit the list of category codes.

I modified the files metahd-item-categories.jsp & SearchPageController.java. Can you double check if it works for you like this?

Thanks
Will
http://distrelec-ch.local:9001/search?q=usb&filter_Category1=Komponenten

As discussed .. You get a comma separated string with category codes.
BR
Petra
integrated category filter in ff search. committed in v3.2. ready for test deployment.

Hi Petra

I added the String categoryRestrictions also to the /search/autocomplete and /search/autocompleteSecure method. Can you do the FE implementation pls?

Thx
Will

[23.01.2015 13:55] Petra Weiss:
auch, merci[23.01.2015 13:57] Petra Weiss:
mir ist noch was eingefallen fürs DISTRELEC-5860 …
könntest du mir hier auf den $

{levelOneCategories} noch pro Category das Attribut „selected“ (boolean) mitgeben? so kann ich auf der Resultateseite (z.B. https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/search?q=gsm&categoryRestrictions=cat-L1D_379516) anzeigen, ob und wenn ja welche Categories selected sind.

… sorry, ist mir erst jetzt beim Implementieren aufgefallen :S …[23.01.2015 13:58] Petra Weiss:
(schreibs sonst gerne ins Ticket, wenn i.O. für dich)[23.01.2015 14:02] Spalinger, Wilhelm Patrick:
also jene kategorien die in dem string categoryRestrictions sind, sollen noch ein boolean attribut selected true/false haben. korrekt?
[23.01.2015 14:03] Spalinger, Wilhelm Patrick:
d.h. das du in den ${levelOneCategories}

dann siehst welche selektiert ist und welche nicht. oder ?
committed v3.2

Done - can be tested after next deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5859] Redesign Header: Base Ticket
item.description:
For the header several redesign measures have been decided upon.

All of them have been specified here: https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/911-4+Redesign+Header (including child pages)

Included Elements:

  • slightly reduced height of the header
  • search
    • new search bar including a scoped search dropdown
    • new suggest layer without tabs and without "show all" link
  • my account
    • new menu replacing the previous my account and the list menus
  • cart
    • new cart flyout

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Daniela
This is on Q now.
Could you please start to test?
If you find any issues please create a new collection ticket.
Thank you.

item.summary: Search Result Page: New Category Component

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Raphael

At the moment, we show just 1st category level on SearchResultPage ($

{searchPageData.categories.values}

).

How can we get the values from 1st subcategories of each category (if there is one available) ?

Thank you & BR
Petra

Could you please clarify with Raphael Husi?
Thx

Hi Nando

This ticket is about this search result page: http://test.distrelec.ch/search?q=widerst%C3%A4nde correct?

I also attached you a screenshot of the actual category component. we change this one right?

Cheers
Will

Hi Willi -

yes, that is the correct component to be changed.

About the page:

  • yes, the search result page,
  • but also category pages (e.g. http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Werkzeuge-%26-Messtechnik/L%C3%B6ten/Unabh%C3%A4ngige-L%C3%B6tkolben/c/cat-L3D_525436)

  • outlet store pages (http://test.distrelec.ch/clearance)

Best,
Nando

Hi Nando

Thx for the information. What about the frontend? Is it already done? Or who will implement it?

Cheers
Will

Hi Will

FE is not done yet. I will implement the FE as soon as the 1st subcategories of each category are available.

BR
Petra

Hi all

Status update: Daniela is checking with FF if its possible to get the category structure out with plugin or something like this.

I gonna update this asap.

Cheers
Will

BR Petra

Hallo Herr Türk

Folgende Problem Situation auf P:

Unterschiedliche Filter in Channel ch_de / ch_fr obwohl Suchresultat gleich. Suche in ch_de nach „zenerdiode“ und in ch_fr nach „diodes zener“

CH_DE:
http://10.191.20.145:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/Search.ff?sid=D00DB29BF4F8171105F796A477D23359&uid=1692933936&cid=&site=demoshop&sourceRefKey=NXnvaMg-5&productsPerPage=10&channel=distrelec_P_7310_ch_de&query=zenerdiode&x=0&y=0
CH_FR:
http://10.191.20.145:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/Search.ff?sid=D00DB29BF4F8171105F796A477D23359&uid=1692933936&cid=&site=demoshop&sourceRefKey=EUSIZOFE1&productsPerPage=10&channel=distrelec_P_7310_ch_fr&query=diodes+zener&x=0&y=0

Im Channel ch_fr fehlen die Filter:

  • Zenerspannung / Résistance Zener
  • Zenerwiderstand / Tension Zener

Ich habe jeweils die 10 ersten Produkte vom Suchresultat überprüft. Datenqualität im hybris passt. Datenqualität im FF export file von hybris passt ebenfalls. Dann habe ich noch den Attribute Export überprüft, auch dort sind die Attribute drin.

Nun weiss ich nicht mehr weiter. Wir exportieren im UTF-8 Format. Wie verarbeitet FF das File?

Können Sie mir hier weiterhelfen?

Besten Dank.

Hallo Herr Spalinger,
der Produktexport wird in eine Datenbank mit ISO-Codepage überführt. Das dürfte hier aber nicht das Problem sein.
Aufgrund der unterschiedlichen Sortierung im Suchergebnis, kann die Filter-Aufstellung sich unterscheiden. Hierzu auch ein Auszug aus dem Customization-Dokument:
Reduction of the records to consider for facet generation
FACT-Finder usually analysis all found records, to find out which facets can be created. With properties in the Framework configuration you can specify min./max. limit of records to be analyzed. The most important setting is the percentage setting which always a dynamic limit depending on the result count.
fff.properties

  1. The minimum amount of records to analyze
    SearchCallback.cutoffForVirtualFieldGenerationMin=100
  2. The maximum amount of records to analyze
    SearchCallback.cutoffForVirtualFieldGenerationMax=1000
  3. The percentage of found records to analyze. If less records are analyzed, FACT-Finder won‘t know all facets. A webuseAttributeCount=-1 will set it to 100 %.
    SearchCallback.cutoffForVirtualFieldGenerationPercentage=25
    Independent of this limitation, the attribute facets contain the elements based on all available records after filtering. These configurations are only ignored, when using the custom-parameter„webuseAttributeCount=-1“ in the search request.

Mit dem Zusatzparameter webuseAttributeCount=-1 können Sie gut nachvollziehen, dass die Attribute grundsätzlich korrekt importiert wurden und die o.g. Limitierungen die Einblendung verhindern.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development

search request mit webuseAttributeCount=-1:

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5176] Search Result Page // Reload Layer
item.description:
Addition of a new "reload layer" feature to the search result pages

Specifications

  • Applies to all pages with a facet bar:
    • normal search result
    • category pages
    • manufacturer store
    • outlet store
    • product finder result pages
  • New checkbox in the (now wider) search top bar
    • Label: "Auto-apply filters"
    • Default state: selected / true
  • Functionality
    • If the checkbox is selected, the search results are updated immediately via ajax once the user selects any facet value (as it is working today).
    • If the checkbox is not selected, upon any facet value selection by the user a reload layer appears over the product list (same basic principle as in the cart). Only once the user clicks on "Click here to update the search result", the product list is updated via ajax, and the reload layer disappears.
      • Color of reload layer: green
      • Label of button: "Click here to update the search result"
      • As it is now possible for the user to select a combination of filters with a result of 0, a distinct zero result page is needed for this case, with the following text
      • "No products could be found for your selection of filters"

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:

And is it possible to have a separate 404 page for the invalid facet selection? Then we could inform the customer accordingly.

-------------------------------------- New specification as of November 2014 --------------------------------------

  • Updated ticket description with new spec
  • Uploaded most current wireframe (SearchReloadLayer.png)
  • Left the original wireframe (Reloadsearchv1.jpg) for reference. However it is based on the old search result list design.
  • Above comment was considered in specs

2 open questions remain:

  • What color should the reload layer have - grey or green?
  • Please provide an icon for the reload layer if desired.

Note:

  • Color should be green
  • No icon in button needed.

<c:forEach items="${ffFilterStrings}" var="facetString">
<c:out value="${facetString.key}" /> | <c:out value="${facetString.value}" /> <br>
</c:forEach>

{facetValue.query.url}

.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5122] SEO - MicroData Optimization
item.description:
Observations :

  • Microdata well tagged on webpages allow a very high CTR on the SERP.
  • We are using Price Microdata on our products :
  • We are not using the full set of microdata offered to us by Google :

Impacts :

  • We are not exploiting all the traffic we could gather due to lower CTR compared to the competition on our results inside the serps.

Demands :

Insert those Microdata tagging (https://developers.google.com/webmasters/richsnippets/) :

  • "Stock" Microdata type (only products pages with stock available):
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/LED-lamp-warm-white-9-5-W-E27-Philips-COREPRO-LEDBULB-9-5-60W-E27/p/11042373 : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Product">
	<div itemprop="name">LED lamp warm white 9.5 W E27, COREPRO LEDBULB 9.5-60W E27, Philips</div>
	<div itemprop="offers" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Offer">
		<div itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF"></div>
		<div itemprop="price" content="13.90"></div>
		<link itemprop="availability" href="http://schema.org/InStock" />
	</div>
</div>
    • Code test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab5453d87218f7f6fe373c989&hl=en
    • Code effect :
  • "Starting From Price" Microdata type (only Category pages)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for https://www.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/Measuring-Instruments/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-Bench-Types/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-234938 :
      A pharse saying "Price from CHF$lowest_product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this ($lowest_product_price="576.72") : 
      <div itemprop="offerDetails" itemscope="" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Offer-aggregate">
	Price from
	<meta itemprop="currency" content="CHF">CHF
	<meta itemprop="lowprice" content="576.72">576.72	
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:800505ea66a4e0bf569562f368eac52d
    • Code effect :
  • "Breadcrumb" Microdata type (on Products and Category pages):
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/185417
    • Code exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/LED-lamp-warm-white-9-5-W-E27-Philips-COREPRO-LEDBULB-9-5-60W-E27/p/11042373 :
      The breadcrumb already in place must be tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/c/cat-L1D_379521"><span itemprop="title">Power Supplies & Lighting</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="/http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/c/cat-L2D_379659"><span itemprop="title">Light sources</span></a>
</div>	
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/c/cat-L3D_525567"><span itemprop="title">LED Lamps</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/c/cat-16343"><span itemprop="title">LED lamps</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/LED-Lamps%2C-E27-Socket/c/cat-348903"><span itemprop="title">LED Lamps, E27 Socket</span></a>
</div>
    • Code test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036847c3d640f474aba15e7ff7dd&hl=en
    • Code effect :
Here is a new one, you can try it
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata type (Only for the Home page):
    • Documentation : https://developers.google.com/webmasters/richsnippets/sitelinkssearch
    • Code for http://www.distrelec.ch pages html head : 
      <script type="application/ld+json">
{
	"@context": "http://schema.org",
	"@type": "WebSite",
	"url": "http://www.distrelec.ch/",
	"potentialAction": {
		"@type": "SearchAction",
		"target": "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q={search_term_string}",
		"query-input": "required name=search_term_string"
	}
}
</script>
    • Code effect :

Checking process :

  • Copy paste of the html inside the richsnippets test plateform : http://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets (no pre-visualization = µdata wrongly implemented !)
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.

Deprecated Demand (Don't implement it):

  • "Price" & "Stock" Microdata type (on Category pages with only one product displayed)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/Measuring-Instruments/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-Bench-Types/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-485635 :
      A pharse saying "Price CHF$product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Product">
	<span itemprop="name">Oscilloscopes, Agilent DSO1000B
	<div itemprop="offers" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Offer">
		<span itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF">CHF
		<span itemprop="price" content="557.28">557.28
		<link itemprop="availability" href="http://schema.org/InStock" />In stock
	</div>
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab444381da09c62327bce7f5b&hl=en
    • Code effect :
  • "Price range" Microdata type (only on Category pages with more than one product displayed)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/LED-Lamps%2C-E27-Socket/c/cat-348903 :
      A pharse saying "Price from CHF$min_product_price to CHF$max_product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Product">
	<span itemprop="name">LED Lamps, E27 Socket</span>
	<span itemprop="offerDetails" itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Offer-aggregate">
		Price from CHF
		<span itemprop="lowPrice">10.10</span>
		to CHF
		<span itemprop="highPrice">14.90</span>
		<meta itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF" />
	</span>
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab30fc481691f41d2c451ce41&hl=en
    • Code effect :

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4483] Search Result Page adjustments
item.description:
Adaptation of search result page as per specification here: https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/911-2b+Search+Result+Page+Adaptations

The adjustments include:

  • New Component "Category Selection" above the search result list. The categories facet is removed from the facet column altogether.
    • covered in separate spec: https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/Categories+Component
    • covered in separate ticket: DISTRELEC-5709
  • Adaptation to the search top bar (between the print/share icons and the actual products): now goes across the full content width including the facet column
  • Introduction of a new functionality: "Auto apply filters"
    • covered in separate spec: https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/Categories+Component
    • covered in separate ticket: DISTRELEC-5176
  • Facet Column
    • Reduction of the width of the facet bar
    • Reduction of the "+" / "-" icon size in the facet bar
  • Product List
    • Expansion of the width of the product list
    • "Cart" icon remains always visible (no change to the other 3 toggles)
    • lighter grey of horizontal lines within product line items

Scope:

  • These changes apply to all product lists with a facet column
    • normal search result pages
    • category product list pages
    • manufacturer store
    • outlet store
    • product finder result pages

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Here a few answers on this:

  • remove white space where possible (between Sie suchten nach XY... & list):
    • What if you have added a campaign (see screenshot)? What about this gap?
  • make H1 size smaller (Sie suchten nach XY)
    • The <H1> is not site specific. If we change it it will be changed on every site. Is this the need?
  • if possible: Mouse-over view or quick view for results with bigger image and more details. For some searches (like "Laserdrucker") there is not much information about the product differences to date  partly a data issue, but partly design --> maybe enough with technical view
    • This will be solved with the new technical view
  • Remove horizontal lines within results to avoid confusion with lines between products
    • I need more information here. Which specific horizontal line do you mean?
  • Sorting: Ascending and descending functionality could be moved outside of drop down (e.g. arrows). This allows quicker overview.
    • Let's discuss this further
  • facet layout in general has to be discussed
    • Let's discuss this further

Layout suggestions for the newly laid out SERP. There is still a decision to be taken if the facets should be put horizontally or in vertical order. This will be decided by the CAB.

When it comes to the detailed specifications of min and max indication, we will need to evaluate the technical specs.

According to the last update I received, the horizontal view was decided upon. The final layout was based on the vertical alignment, though. That's why I left one of the former drafts as an example how the horizontal layout was meant to be. All the other elements can be taken from the final layout (with the ending _GK).

-------------------------------------- New specification as of November 2014 --------------------------------------

  • Updated ticket description with new spec (or rather links to new specs)
  • Uploaded most curent wireframes
  • All above comments are about the old spec and don't concern the new one.

Some information from FF: Die Kategorien müssten Shop-seitig in der Session gespeichert werden, damit man die Parent-Kategorien – auch nach Filterung – uneingeschränkt anzeigen kann. Zudem wäre der Verzicht auf die Abhängigkeiten und die Aktivierung der Mehrfachauswahl hier von Vorteil.

After a discussion with Raphael, it will be pretty impossible to - sensibly - display the categories as intended. An idea would be to display what we have today, but just horizontally to give the category facets more attention.
See http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-5709 for adaptation of the category component based on the above comment
Resolved for v3.2; the only thing still open at the moment is the reload layer (covered in DISTRELEC-5176), which is also planned for v3.2.

Hi Daniela

This is on Q now.
Could you please start to test?

If you find any issues please add it to the following ticket:
http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-6314

Thank you.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6023] Product detail page adjustments
item.description:
As discussed with Florian, here a few inputs for the "finetuning" of the product detail page:

  • Change tab title from "Technical attributes" to "Product details" (Translations come)
  • Change tab title from "Similar product(s)" to "Product family" (translations already existing)
  • Remove the titles (technical data & additional attributes) for the technical attributes
  • Remove the first and the last line in the attributes list
  • Put the search for similar checkboxes behind the data, so that it is aligned with the "search for similar products" button
  • add the description besides the button: "To show similar products, select at least one checkbox and click on the button beside"
  • Remove, if possible the subtitles of Family description, etc, as you already have the title "Family Information" and they are redundant
  • Reduce space between the H3 title and the informations (that it looks like the Family description section in the attached screenshots)

The two last points really are only if possible. The information section of the technical attributes, though, should be adjusted. To (hopefully) clarify the points, I attached a little mockup

"Product details"

FR: Détail produit

LT: Apžvalga

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5971] Clear all filter-button on SERP
item.description:
As discussed, there should be the functionality of removing all the previously selected filters with one click.

We have an old visualization from Wolfgang, but it's based on the suggestion of fyayc. It could be added somehow to it like in the second visualization.

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment:
Summary:

  • Addition of a "clear all filters [x|" functionality to the title bar of the "Filter" box in the facet column

Hi Florian,

Should the Behaviour for both Ways (Search / enter over Category) be the same, when the user clicks on the "remove all filter" link?

Which page should open when you click the link?

Search
Search Page with original search string?

Product List (over category)
Category Page? Which one? (When you enter the product list over categories, you have at least 2 Categories as active filters)

Could you please answer Jan's questions?
Thx.

Ideally, we would have two different "show filter" fields. One for the categories and one for the technical attributes and then also the possibility, to deselect all choices there.

Would that be possible?

After discussion with Florian, the approach is the following:

  • Search
    • => yes, go back to the original search string
  • Product list over category
    • 1) If possible: Go back to the first page that was a product list (and not a category page with the octagons). Note that this is not always the same level
    • 2) If 1) is not possible: Go back to the page that results when also the the "preselected" category filters are removed (e.g. from here http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/Aktive-Bauelemente/Diskrete-Halbleiter-R%C3%B6hren/Br%C3%BCckengleichrichter/c/cat-L3D_525226 to here http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/Aktive-Bauelemente/c/cat-L2D_379524). In the case of this approach it should be investigated whether the filter box can always be empty (not showing any categories) when the user first arrives on a product list. Will create separate ticket if needed.

Good morning Florian

From BE-side we need for ProductList over Category v1) following:
– link from first page that was a product list (without possibly set filterstring)

To determine this link, BE could check all categories above current page
– check if it's the first product list page
– give this link of page to FE for creating clear-all button

Note, if current page already is the first product list page, link shouldn't be delivered. In this case «clear all» link won't be shown.

It should also be checked, if we are able to show only links in filter box, which link to product list (not showing any category links).

Could you assign this issue to one of your BE-Engineers, please?
Thank you and BR
Petra

Hi Petra,

I added a new field called 

${searchPageData.removeFiltersURL}

which contains the URL without the " filter_* " paramters.

BR, Nabil

Hi Nabil

Thank you. With

${searchPageData.removeFiltersURL}

I get the link of current page without filter-params. But for this issue we need the link of first page that was a product list (without possibly set filterstring).

For example, if you look at https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/de/Komponenten/Aktive-Bauelemente/Diskrete-Halbleiter-R%C3%B6hren/Br%C3%BCckengleichrichter/Br%C3%BCckengleichrichter/c/cat-20140?q=* needed link would be following: https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/de/Komponenten/Aktive-Bauelemente/Diskrete-Halbleiter-R%C3%B6hren/Br%C3%BCckengleichrichter/c/cat-L3D_525226?q=*&filter_Category3=Diskrete+Halbleiter+%2F+R%C3%B6hren&filter_Category4=Br%C3%BCckengleichrichter.

Please see attached screenshot (distrelec_clear-all_categoryPage.png) for clarification. The category tagged with «1. is productlist» is the first page that was a product list. For determining this link, I guess you have somehow to look up the actual category tree (starting at current page) and check every page, if it's the first product list page or not.

And following question is still open:
Are we able to show only links in filter box, which link to a product list (not showing any category links)?

Thank you and BR,
Petra

Hi Petra,

I tried the URLs that you mentioned in your above comment. However, the URL https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/de/Komponenten/Aktive-Bauelemente/Diskrete-Halbleiter-R%C3%B6hren/Br%C3%BCckengleichrichter/c/cat-L3D_525226?q=* , which is supposed to be the URL without filters, contains also some filters (c.f. screenshot).

Hi all,

As approved by Florian Bühler | Distrelec, we stop at level 3 category. Since all level 2 pages contains anyway the octagons, so we do not go above L3 categories.

BR, Nabil

Hi Petra,

please see my comment above.
FE integration done. Can be tested after next deployment.

Done.

BR
Petra

We have two bugs with the remove all functionality when navigating:

1. When removing all the filters you end up at the homepage. This does not make sense, as the expectation of the customer is to remove the chosen filters, but not to change the location. You should end up at the last category level which is displayed as tiles (basically the location from where the customer started filtering --> a CR will follow for category selection, soon). This behaviour is even more confusing when you remove the category filter one by one - then you end up at the right place (last category with tile-style). So this should be adjusted.

2. If you navigate down to family level, all the previously selected filters disappear in the "filter" section and there is no possibility to remove the category selection anymore (the technical attributes can be unselected by clicking on the value again - but this should not be the only way to remove filters). The filters should stay, no matter on what category level you navigate.

Hi Daniela,
Point 1: Is this still the case on Q now?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5960] SEO - Empty Category Pages Issues - Category with 0 results to redirect in 301 to upper hierarchy level
item.description:
Observations :

  • There is a fluctuation of our assortment of products over time.
  • This product fluctuation affect the active category pages.
  • Manual maintenance on PIM also create a fluctuation on category pages.
  • This result into 15 to 20% of accessible category pages inside hybris with 0 results category pages. (10% on /c/cat-D* pattern, 20 % on /c/cat-numericID pattern)
  • Google have & is crawling and indexing those pages.
  • Those pages have and will accumulate over time "seo weight".

Impacts :

  • Google is wasting crawl time on 0 content pages.
  • Over the time this number is going to grow.
  • No SEO correction = Destroying the accumulated seo weight of those previously content filled pages.
  • No SEO correction is an equivalent of a failed SEO migration

Demands :

  • Redirect in 301 the 0 results category/manufaturer pages to there upper category/level.
    • Exemple 1 :
      This empty category page :
      http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/Relais-%26-Schalter/Ger%C3%A4teschalter/Industrie-Kippschalter/Miniatur-Kippschalter/Zubeh%C3%B6r/c/cat-DC-21695
      Must be redirect in 301 to the upper category level :
      http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/Relais-%26-Schalter/Ger%C3%A4teschalter/Industrie-Kippschalter/Miniatur-Kippschalter/c/cat-DC-1101
    • Exemple 2 :
      This empty manufacturer page :
      http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/manufacturer/kabeltronik/man_kbl
      Must be redirect in 301 to the manufacturers page :
      http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/manufacturer/

Checking process :

  • The correction must be deployed on Q before Production environment to properly test it.
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - Empty Category Pages Issues - Category with 0 results to redirect in 301 to upper hierarchy level

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment: As we discussed with Francesco, It is not possible to do this. Hence I m forwarding it to you.
I will check with PIM if something is doable.
@Francesco : If I'm providing inside PIM import a column for every category with a redirection id to use, is it more doable like this ?

The issue has been solved implementing this logic.

The redirection works only for search bots
The redirection is done recursively until a category with at least one product is found. Or until the root category.

All the other cases will work as usual.

It's very important to know that the check of the number of products is peformed through the factfinder index. This means speed.
But, on the other hand, we have to wait until the fact finder export is done, and the FF system is then aware of the status of the category structure.

Great news, thank you Francesco.
When will it be deploy on Q ?

We're going to deploy now the new release v3.2.m0
Tomorrow you can test.

@Francesco : I just tried it on Q, it does'nt seem to work
(http://test.distrelec.ch/de/*/c/cat-DC-21695 is not redirected anywhere)

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4623] SEO - Sitemap Issues - Full sitemap + alternate language to provide
item.description:
Observations :

  • For every website on the hybris plateform we are using sitemaps (https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/156184?hl=en)
  • We host one index of sitemap (http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap_index.xml) which list all the sitemaps (http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap1.xml.gz).
  • Those sitemap are respecting google sitemap index formating (https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/75712?rd=1&hl=en) and "general url" sitemaps formating (https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/183668?hl=en&ref_topic=6080646&rd=1).
    sample_sitemap_index.xml
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<sitemapindex xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9">
	<sitemap>
		<loc>http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap1.xml.gz</loc>
		<lastmod>2014-09-30T03:49:22.642+02:00</lastmod>
	</sitemap>
</sitemapindex>
    sample_sitemap1.xml
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<urlset xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9" >
	<url>
		<loc>http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Isolation-%C3%B8-2-mm-weiss-Multi-Contact-KT2-F-withe/p/14048066</loc>
		<lastmod>2014-09-22</lastmod>
	</url>
</urlset>
  • We can find inside the current distrelec.ch sitemaps :
    • Product url for German language (http://www.distrelec.ch/de/*/p/idproduct : sitemap1~8.xml)
    • Category url for German language (http://www.distrelec.ch/de/*/*/*/*/c/cat-idcat : sitemap8.xml)
  • We don't provide the other major pattern of landing pages :
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-L1D_idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-L2D_idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-L2-3D_idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-L3D_idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-D*-idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/manufacturer/brand-name
  • 55% of the url proposed inside the sitemap lead to 302 redirections : http://www.distrelec.ch/de/PVC-Starkstromlitze,-H05-V-K-0,75-qmm-dbl----/p/90040410 -302> http://www.distrelec.ch/de/PVC-Starkstromlitze%2C-H05-V-K-0%2C75-qmm-dbl-kabeltronik---660107512/p/serviceplus/90040410
  • 50% of product url are "service +" products : serviceplus/90040410" class="external-link" rel="nofollow">http://www.distrelec.ch/de/PVC-Starkstromlitze%2C-H05-V-K-0%2C75-qmm-dbl-kabeltronik---660107512/p/serviceplus/90040410
  • Language alternatives of all the landing pages, are not proposed.
    GoogleBot crawl ratio on the language structure of our pages :

Impacts :

  • By providing incomplete or wrong information about our landing pages, we drastically limit the crawlers comprehension of our structure and the positive effect of sitemaps.

Demands :

  • Provide only those landing page type absolute path inside sitemaps :
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-L1D_idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-L2D_idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-L2-3D_idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-L3D_idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-D*-idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-M*-idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/lang/*/c/cat-idcat
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/*
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/*/p/product-id
  • Don't provide :
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/*/cms/*
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/cms/*
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/search
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/checkToggles
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/cart
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/checkout
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/my-account
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/login
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/import-tool
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/support
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/feedback
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/medias/sys_master/*.js
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/_ui/all/cache/*.js
    • http://www.distrelec.ch//app/etc/local.xml
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/medias/sys_master/*.gz
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/gsitemap*.xml.gz
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/*/p/serviceplus/*
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/*/ServicePlusShop/*
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/*/p/*/alsoBought*
    • http://www.distrelec.ch/*/p/*/recommendation*
      ...
  • All url provided must be final url (no redirections between).
  • Provide all the products but not the "/p/serviceplus/*" products.
  • Provide every language equivalent for every url, example with http://www.distrelec.ch/Components/c/cat-L1D_379509
    exemple_sitemap_language_alternate.xml
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<urlset 
	xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9"
	xmlns:xhtml="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
 	<url>
		<lastmod>YYYY-MM-DD</lastmod>
		<loc>http://www.distrelec.ch/Komponenten/c/cat-L1D_379509</loc>
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="de" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="en" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Components/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="fr" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/Composants/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
	</url>
	<url>
		<lastmod>YYYY-MM-DD</lastmod>
		<loc>http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/c/cat-L1D_379509</loc>
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="x-default" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/Komponenten/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="en" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Components/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="fr" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/Composants/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
	</url>
	<url>
		<lastmod>YYYY-MM-DD</lastmod>
		<loc>http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Components/c/cat-L1D_379509</loc>
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="x-default" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/Komponenten/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="de" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="fr" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/Composants/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
	</url>
	<url>
		<lastmod>YYYY-MM-DD</lastmod>
		<loc>http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/Composants/c/cat-L1D_379509</loc>
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="x-default" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/Komponenten/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="de" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
			<xhtml:link rel="alternate" hreflang="en" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Components/c/cat-L1D_379509" />
	</url>
</urlset>
  • Xml tags details
    Tag Description
    <urlset> Encloses all information about the set of URLs included in the Sitemap.
    <url> Encloses all information about a specific URL.
    <loc> Specifies the URL.
    <lastmod> The date the URL was last modifed, in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD format (time value is optional).
  • For data analitycs, sitemaps must be splitted by url pattern :
    Exemple :
    http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap_product_1.xml.gz
    http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap_cat_1.xml.gz
    http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap_cat-L1D_1.xml.gz
    http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap_cat-L2D_1.xml.gz
    http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap_cat-L2-3D_1.xml.gz
    http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap_cat-L3D_1.xml.gz
    http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap_cat-D_1.xml.gz (put /c/cat-DC-id, /c/cat-DD-id, /c/cat-MG-id)
    http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap_manufacturer_1.xml.gz
  • For crawlers comprehension, a sitemap file can contain no more than 50,000 URLs and must be no larger than 10MB when uncompressed.
    If it's the case, split the sitemap by 50k part and modify the suffix "_incremental-number" at every splited sitemap starting by "_1" for the first sitemap and "_2" for the second etc...
    Edit : The alternate data make the sitemap a lot heavier, to comply to the rule of no more than 50k and no more than 10MB, we will split them by 15k of url.
  • Every new sitemap generated must be indicated inside the sitemap index : http://www.distrelec.ch/sitemap_index.xml

Checking process :

  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4593] SEO - URL Duplications Issues - Between Manufacturer - 301 to add and db to clean
item.description:
Observations :

  • On http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/, several manufacturers seems duplicated :
  • CRITICAL UPDATE 27/07/14 : On http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux product contents have disappeared and "Manufacturer not found" message appear.

Impacts :

  • SEO :
    • This bug create pure DUST (Different URLs, Similar Text) duplicate.
    • That lead into duplication of content, waste of crawl and finally not be ranked properly inside the search engine result pages.
  • CRITICAL UPDATE 27/07/14 : SEM/Emailing/Marketing :
    • All campaign that target manufacturer landing page lead to empty landing pages

Demands :

  • Removal of the wrong anchor and links on http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/ : OK
  • For tracking purpose, the tracking suffix shouldn’t get lost during the redirections : NOK
  • EDIT : 05/08/14 : SAP manufacturer id force us to make a compromise on the manufacturer url behavior,
    we will have to redirect in http 301 all cropped manufacturer name url and their one original url to this pattern "http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/full_brand_name/sap_cropped_brand_name
    • Exemple :
      • http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux/aul :NOK
      • http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/aul -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux/aul : OK
  • EDIT 28/08/14 : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer to fix : OK

Checking process :

  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - URL Duplications Issues - Between Manufacturer - 301 to add and db to clean

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment:
Live check :

  • Removal of the wrong anchor and links : OK
  • 301 redirect of the wrong manufacturer : NOK linked to https://jira.namics.com/browse/DISTRELEC-4597 issue N°7

=> Reopening of the issue

Live check 28/07/14 :
- Removal of the wrong anchor and links : NOK, still wrong links on the page
- 301 redirect of the wrong manufacturer : NOK

New evolution, all the good url (exemple http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux) are now providing an error "Manufacturer not found" and no content on the page.
As requested previously, we must keep the full naming structure for the manufacturer and redirect in http 301 the cropped named pages to the full named once.
Product content must appear on the full named manufacturer pages ASAP !

These are the manufacturers that are listed in the footer, but not available in the system:

===Start statistic of manufacturers===
Manufacturers listed in manufacturer page [1347]

Manufacturer [ban_boehler] does not exist.
Manufacturer [sony] does not exist.
Manufacturer [amprobe] does not exist.
Manufacturer [brother] does not exist.
===End statistic of manufacturers===

I've created the ticket DISTRELEC-4688 to change the content of the footer.

On the current version I cannot find any duplicated manufacturer.
Manufacturer Accuride only occurs once (/manufacturer/acu)

The manufacturer have been deduplicated, but only the bad one have been kept :

We just need :
1 - The content back on the /manufacturer/not-cropped-named (exemple : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux)
2 - The links to the /manufacturer/not-cropped-named on the /manufacturer/ page (exemple : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux)
3 - 301 redirect from /manufacturer/cropped-named to /manufacturer/not-cropped-named (exemple : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acc -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux)

Live check :
NOK
Florian, for this i need the list of the list of the mapping between the "old" manufacturer code and the new one.
https://jira.namics.com/browse/DISTRELEC-4689

Here the description of the solution.

The old PIM manufacturer code is now deprecated (eg: for Bosch the manufacturer code was bosch)
www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bosch
The new SAP manufacturer code is now used (eg: for Bosh the new manufacturer code is bsh)
www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bsh

To make the maufacturer url SEO compliant we will add the manufacturer name to the url in that way: www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/[manufacturer-name]/[manufacturer-code]
For Bosch the manufacturer url will look like this:
www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh
This URL will be exposed everywhere in the webshop as new canonical URL, in this way will be crawled.

Here the note about redirects:

  • OLD url will be redirected to the new CANONICAL url
    This is useful because the search engines still have the old urls
    Example: www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bosch ----> www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh
  • NEW url will be redirected to the new CANONICAL url
    This because internally the webshop will refer only to the new url
    Example: www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bsh----> www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh

@francesco : Thx, for the details.
For the rewritten url, it's highly preferable to avoid capital letter.
Capital letter inside url just lead to side effect and maintenance problems in SEO and linking.
Exemple :
Bad : www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh
Good : www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bosch/bsh

Implementation is done
What is missing is to finalize the apache redirects for old->new manufacturer codes.

Thank you Francesco, that's great !
Tell me when you need me to do the check on http://test.distrelec.ch
Please test, thanks!

Checklist :

  • http://test.distrelec.ch/manufacturer : all the manufacturer link anchor on the page replaced " " by "+", we don't want this replacement : NOK
  • http://test.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/accuride : they should be a 301 redirect to http://test.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/accuride/man_acu : NOK
  • http://test.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acu : 301 redirect to http://test.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/accuride/man_acu : OK
  • http://test.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/accuride/man_acu : there is a prefixe "man_" iniside the url, if possible, remove it : (see with francesco, not possible to remove) OK

Hi Pierre
I assume we cannot go live with this right?

It's possible to go live since it will be the same situation (just a 301 from the bugged manufacturer page to the new manufacturer pages).
But it is indeed preferable to go live with everything operational. (the 301 from the old manufacturer page to the the ones)

When is it planned to do the redirection from the legacy manufacturer page to new one /manufacturer/*/man_* ?
(this update is just a load of rules inside the htacess...)
The old manufacturer page redirection are still not operational, I reopen.

It has to be done by the PIM manager, to check with Önder.

@Francesco :
Please find redirections rules.xlsx file joined.
http://jira.distrelec.ch/secure/attachment/15248/redirections%20rules.xlsx
These are the redirections rules to use on all hybris websites.
To avoid non desired overlapping rules, those manufacturer rules must be placed at the beggining of the existing manufacturer rules (the old once will be used as a fallback).
